title: Bryce Canyon National Park: Plan Your Visit
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit           Plan Your Visit        Thor's Hammer in the fall. Photographed by Brian B. Roanhorse October 1, 2014       Make the Most of Your Visit  Bryce Canyon National Park offers something special for everyone. Consult the online hiking guide for help in picking the perfect trail.  Take the virtual tour for a glimpse of Bryce Canyon's roadside grandeur.  Don't forget to read about the shuttle service so you can plan your day.         We Invite You to Stay Overnight Bryce Canyon offers two campground sites (one in winter) and lodging is available at the Bryce Canyon Lodge during the summer season. During winter, hotel rooms are available in the park at the Sunset Hotel.   Enjoy ranger program(s), whether it be a moonlit guided hike (year-around), telescope stargazing (seasonal), and daily evening programs (seasonal). Attend our Geology Talk (year-around) and learn how Bryce Canyon was formed.   On horseback is another way to experience Bryce Canyon during the summer season. Registration is at the Bryce Canyon Lodge.   Ask about our Jr. Ranger Program at the visitor information desk. There are activities for everyone!         Trail rides at Bryce Canyon. Register at the Bryce Canyon Lodge. NPS Photo
